column5: I had the day off but decided to relax, watch a whole season of trailer park boys and not fish.  By 2:00pm when I finished Season 5, I decided it was too nice of a day.  Tidied up around the house so as not to be murdered in my sleep, then picked up my dad and we were off to the lake in search of some big smallies!  We made a long run to my spot from last week and got into a bunch of fish in the 2-3 pound range.  Fun, but not what we were after.  Swamped the front of the boat twice heading across the lake to another good zone, the wind picked up pretty good.  Glad we did!  Pulled up to my waypoint in 30 feet of water and first cast with a dropshot, my bait was in the water maybe 3 seconds and it bolted sideways with a 4 pounder on the other end of it.  Tangled with about 15 more in the 3.5-5 pound range even after the wind died down and the sun started to go down the fish were biting good.  Great day on the water with my old man, we made some memories today with 3 double headers to top it off!  Thanks for reading!        http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JlHHAZIlhkE
awesome steve. you're a bass catching machine.
awesome fish!!!  they sure do make them big in simcoe!  Cheers!
talk about consistent.  it seems like every time you hit the lake your firing up the camera.  great fishing stories and pics.  i wish i could spend more time in your area.

Amazing report! I've noticed that my best summer smallie action comes the last week of July, first week of August. Especially if there is a heat wave.  Just curious. What kind of boat do you have and what horsepower Steve?
Legend XCalibur 179 with a 75HP Mercury 4 Stroke.  She's no speed demon but handles Simcoe's rollers better than any bass boat I've had out there.
Thanks. I was looking at those boats. I thinks it's $20,000 out the door brand new.
Steve, those Simcoe smallies are amazing!!!!
beauty fish, nice work!

Amazing looking fish.  I work in the barrie are and let me just throw it out there that if you are ever looking for a fishing partner for a day of smallie fishing drop me a line.  I've never caught a simcoe smallie just a bunch of largemouth.
Those are some great smallies! Spending the evening with your dad pounding bronze even better.
Nice fish...  Wondering if you notice any fizz marks on them?  Curious to know how many have em?  Cheers
Wow those are pigs!
nice hogs. How did the Friday night tourney go?
I made a seperate post on that, we came 2nd with like 13lbs, winners had just over 16.  It was a tough bite for sure, our best bite was between 1am-2am
Now that looks like fun, some sweet look'n smallies Steve Richard
Steve man i'm gonna talk to Legend and lend you a new one every 2 years.  it's amazing how many hours you put on the water with your Legend
World class fishing right there, very impressive.
That sounds like SPONSORSHIP! Hmmmm, good deal all round i think.
nice smallies, congrats!
BRUISERS - awesome Steve - always awesome!
thats incredible
Where do I sign? lol
